column4: hi there, i was wondering if there was any way I could set up mplayer as my default video streaming plugin in firefox ... it keeps using totem and totem seriously sucks
Install mozilla-mplayer
And remove totem-mozilla.
i have 6.10 and every time i try mozilla-mplayer, it acts like the package doesn't exist
i.e. enable multiverse
how do i do that?
Of course not. Nothing is really NECESSARY in ubuntu.
Especially not media players.
Have you restarted firefox? If so, type about:plugins in the address bar and pastebin the whole page.
Right-click on mplayer-plugin, go to configure, and check "Connect to RTSP media over TCP"
alright, done ... now when i run a quicktime, it runs, but some of the video is cut out
cut out?
ok nevermind, quicktime works fine now ... only cnn is left
Does selecting x11 as your video driver in configure help?
Also, you are refreshing when you change these settings, right?
heh, nothing was selected.. i just put it on gl
Try x11.
should that fix cnn.com's video too?
I don't know what's wrong with it. It works for me. *shrug*
That would do it.
vlc?! What does that have to do with mplayer?
No, install w32codecs
Install w32codecs.
when i try to install w32codecs, it tells me that 'no candidate version found for w32codecs'
